problems.title: Selection Sort
problems.description:
Problem Statement
Implement the Selection Sort algorithm to sort an array of N integers in non-decreasing order.

Selection Sort works by repeatedly finding the minimum element from the unsorted part of the array and putting it at the beginning. The algorithm maintains two subarrays in a given array: the part which is already sorted and the remaining part which is unsorted.

Input Format
- First line: An integer N, the number of elements.
- Second line: N space-separated integers.

Output Format
- Print the sorted array elements separated by spaces.

Example 1
Input:
5
64 25 12 22 11

Output:
11 12 22 25 64

Example 2
Input:
4
5 4 3 2

Output:
2 3 4 5
hintsList: In each iteration, find the index of the minimum element in the unsorted part.
Swap the found minimum element with the first element of the unsorted part.
The sorted part grows from left to right.
